concept.title: Problems with links in re-used content

conbody.p: There is a danger in including links (xref elements) within the text of a topic. This potential problem did not exist in many earlier authoring environments. But with comprehensive content re-use, the eventual context of a topic is unknown to the author. Including a link creates a dependency on the link target. If the source topic is used in a collection (or information set) that does not include the target, the link will be broken.

The solution to this problem in DITA is map-based linking. Links can be automatically generated at the bottom of each topic, with the links based on either the structure of the hierarchy of topicrefs in the ditamap, or instructions in a relationship table in the map.
